title: Jota funeral: Liverpool squad, family pay respects
content: Family, friends and teammates gathered to pay their respects to Diogo Jota and his brother, André Silva, whose funerals were held Saturday morning.

title: L.A. routed 18-1 in worst loss at Dodger Stadium
content: The Dodgers took a 17-run defeat on the chin, falling 18-1 to the Astros in the team's worst loss ever at Dodger Stadium.

title: Raleigh ties M's record with 35 HRs before break
content: Cal Raleigh matched Ken Griffey Jr.'s franchise record for home runs before the All-Star break, hitting his 34th and 35th homers of the season during a 6-0 win over the Pirates.

title: Different Soto propels Mets to Subway Series win
content: Juan Soto went 3-for-4 with a home run, double and single, falling just a triple shy of the cycle in the Mets' 6-5 comeback win over the Yankees.

title: Ex-Texans, Eagles LB Braman in cancer treatment
content: Former Texans and Eagles linebacker Bryan Braman is undergoing treatment for a rare, aggressive form of cancer, with his longtime agent describing the situation as extremely serious.

title: Sheinbaum hopes Chávez Jr. does time in Mexico
content: President Claudia Sheinbaum says she hopes boxer Julio César Chávez Jr., who was arrested Wednesday in Los Angeles for overstaying his visa, "will be deported and serve the sentence in Mexico."

title: Fever's Clark to miss 5th straight Sat. vs. Sparks
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark will miss her fifth straight game with a left groin injury when Indiana plays host to the Los Angeles Sparks.

title: Chestnut reclaims Nathan's hot dog contest title
content: Famed competitive eater Joey Chestnut reclaimed his title at the Nathan's Famous Fourth of July hot dog eating contest after after skipping last year's gastronomic battle in New York for the coveted Mustard Belt.

title: ❤️ Oasis pays tribute to Diogo Jota on tour
content: Oasis began its comeback tour Friday night in front of a sold-out crowd at Principality Stadium in Cardiff, Wales. During the show, the band paid its respects to the late Liverpool forward Diogo Jota.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: Angel Reese, Alyssa Thomas and 10 more predicted All-Star reserves
content: Which 12 players could fill out the WNBA All-Star roster? We make some predictions -- and discuss some cuts.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Four top-10 teams debut at highest rankings of 2025
content: While the Astros continue their ascent, the Rays and Blue Jays are threatening the Yankees in the AL East.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: What to know about U.S. vs. Mexico: Gold Cup final preview, predictions, more
content: Sunday's Gold Cup final is a reunion for the Concacaf rivals U.S. and Mexico, but who has the edge heading into the festivities at Houston's NRG Stadium? Here's what you need to know.

title: A club defined by disorder, Chelsea reach Club World Cup semis like only they know how
content: On a day they were fined by UEFA and scored on by one of their future players, Chelsea still found a way to defeat Palmeiras and reach the Club World Cup semifinals.

title: British Grand Prix at 75: Silverstone, Aintree, Brands Hatch in pictures
content: IN PHOTOS: ESPN looks through the 75-year history of the British Grand Prix in all its guises at Aintree, Brands Hatch and Silverstone.

title: Defiant Verstappen guarded over Mercedes speculation
content: Max Verstappen refused to comment on ongoing speculation he might leave Red Bull for Mercedes in 2026.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: Who’s the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever? No. 10? No. 262?!? We named top all-time selections at every slot
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: UEFA fines Chelsea, Barçelona over violations
content: Chelsea were fined €20 million for breaking financial monitoring rules and Barcelona were ordered to pay €15m by UEFA on Friday.

title: Young USMNT ready for 'hostile' crowd vs. Mexico
content: USMNT's Walker Zimmerman said that the Gold Cup semifinal win over Guatemala was a "good taste" of what it's like to play in a hostile environment.

title: Sources: Utd tell wantaway stars to delay return
content: Manchester United have told five players including Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho to delay their return to training to allow them more time to find moves away from the club, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ex-Arsenal midfielder Partey charged with rape
content: Former Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey has been charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault by the Metropolitan Police Service.

title: 'Devastated': Liverpool teammates grieve Jota
content: Diogo Jota's teammates at Liverpool including Virgil van Dijk and Jordan Henderson have been expressing their grief following the forward's death.

title: Source: Messi, Miami remain in contract talks
content: Negotiations between Inter Miami CF and Lionel Messi over a contract extension remain ongoing, a source told ESPN.

title: Williams shuns Barça, signs 10-year Athletic deal
content: Nico Williams has signed a new contract with Athletic Club until 2035, snubbing Barcelona's advances to sign him from the Basque side this summer.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Brand's long-range strike sparks Germany
content: A stunning goal by Jule Brand helped send Germany past Poland, as Sweden edged rivals Denmark. Here's what you need to know from Friday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Fantasy Baseball Forecaster for Week 16: July 7-13
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead with our forecaster, which has pitcher rankings, hitter ratings and more.

title: Sleepers, busts and breakouts for 2025
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arteta sets two-week deadline for Gyökeres
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta wants a new striker to be at the club within a fortnight as talks over Viktor Gyökeres drag on. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gyökeres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Ranking the fights: Usyk-Dubois 2, Taylor-Serrano 3, Pacquiao's return and more
content: From Oleksandr Usyk, a women's trilogy fight and Manny Pacquiao's return, ESPN picks July's best fights.

title: Caught on cam: Bizman Gopal Khemka shot dead in Bihar; SIT formed to probe incident
content: In Patna, businessman Gopal Khemka was fatally shot near his residence, with CCTV footage capturing the bike-borne assailant. The incident occurred close to Gandhi Maidan, prompting a Special Investigation Team (SIT) led by the SP City Central to investigate. This shooting follows a similar attack six years prior, where Khemka's son, a BJP leader, was also killed.

title: Alert! Shubman Gill breaks Virat Kohli's massive record
content: Shubman Gill has eclipsed Virat Kohli's record to become the highest run-scorer in his debut Test series as India's captain. He achieved this feat during the second Test against England at Edgbaston, amassing 460 runs in four innings. Gill's impressive performance, including a remarkable 269, leading a young team in challenging English conditions, underscores his class and composure.

title: 'Destroyed evidence': Who is Nehal Modi? Nirav Modi’s brother held in US
content: Nehal Modi, brother of fugitive Nirav Modi, faces extradition to India after his US arrest on July 4. Accused of money laundering and criminal conspiracy in the Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam, he allegedly siphoned off Rs 6,498 crore. The extradition hearing is set for July 17, 2025, with US prosecutors opposing bail.

title: PM Modi in Argentina: Why Buenos Aires trip is vital for India
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Argentina marks the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister in 57 years, aiming to strengthen ties in areas like energy, critical minerals, and trade. Discussions with President Javier Milei will focus on cooperation in agriculture, mining, and renewable energy, with India eyeing Argentina's shale reserves and lithium resources for energy security.

title: Microsoft 'quits' Pakistan after 25 years: Founding country manager says...
content: After 25 years, Microsoft is reportedly exiting Pakistan, a move confirmed by the founding head of Microsoft Pakistan, Jawwad Rehman, via a LinkedIn post. The company commenced operations in June 2000 but has gradually reduced its presence.

title: 'Balasaheb must be blessing me': Fadnavis on Thackeray reunion; takes 'rudali' swipe at Uddhav
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis derided Uddhav Thackeray's speech at a joint rally as a 'rudali' act, not a victory celebration. Fadnavis criticised Uddhav for focusing on his government's fall rather than the language issue. He also took dig at Raj Thackeray, who had humorously credited Fadnavis for uniting him and Uddhav on stage. The rally celebrated the rollback of Hindi as a third language in schools.

title: 'Aapka waqt bura shuru': Hasin Jahan calls Shami characterless
content: The Calcutta High Court has directed cricketer Mohammed Shami to pay Rs 4 lakh monthly to his estranged wife, Hasin Jahan, and their daughter. This includes Rs 1.5 lakh for Jahan and Rs 2.5 lakh for their daughter, retrospectively applied over seven years.

title: PNB scam: Fugitive Nirav Modi's brother Nehal held in US on India's request
content: Nehal Modi, brother of Nirav Modi, has been apprehended in the USA following extradition requests from the ED and CBI. He faces charges of money laundering and criminal conspiracy related to the PNB scam. Investigations reveal his involvement in concealing and transferring illicit funds through shell companies, with a status conference scheduled for July 17, 2025.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: Electoral roll revision: Rabri asks people to ‘refuse’ document checks by poll officials
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal urged Bihar residents to resist showing documents beyond voter IDs during the Election Commission's intensive electoral roll revision, alleging a conspiracy to disenfranchise poor voters. The Election Commission defended the revision as a routine update before elections, addressing past complaints about voter list authenticity.

title: Fastest century, youngest ever! 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates history
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Indian batter, etched his name in history by smashing a century off just 52 balls against England U-19. This explosive innings not only broke Sarfaraz Khan's record to become the youngest Indian to score a Youth ODI century but also surpassed Kamran Ghulam's record for the fastest Youth ODI century.

title: Hindi row: Cong slams Thackeray cousins for hogging credit for govt's rollback
content: Congress has criticized Uddhav and Raj Thackeray for taking sole credit for the government's reversal on introducing Hindi in Maharashtra schools, emphasizing that widespread opposition from various groups led to the decision.

title: Musk reiterates push to deorbit ISS: SpaceX CEO says ‘It’s time to retire…’
content: Elon Musk has once again advocated for the deorbiting of the International Space Station (ISS), suggesting a shift in focus towards Mars missions. Citing the ISS's diminishing utility and the high costs of extending its lifespan, Musk proposes redirecting resources to private ventures and Mars exploration.

title: India’s tour of Bangladesh postponed; BCCI issues statement - more inside
content: The highly anticipated India's white-ball tour of Bangladesh, initially scheduled for August 2025, has been postponed to September 2026, according to the BCCI. The series includes three ODIs and three T20Is. The decision was made considering international cricketing commitments and scheduling convenience for both teams. This postponement follows rising diplomatic tensions and logistical concerns.

title: 'Pakistan open to extraditing terrorists Hafiz, Azhar to India': Bilawal Bhutto
content: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari stated Pakistan is open to extraditing terror suspects, including Hafiz Saeed and Masood Azhar, to India as a goodwill gesture, contingent on India's cooperation in providing evidence and witnesses for ongoing domestic cases. He claimed Masood Azhar is likely in Afghanistan and dismissed claims of Hafiz Saeed's freedom, asserting he is in Pakistani custody.

title: Space burial goes wrong: Capsule with remains of people crashes into Pacific ocean
content: A space burial mission by Celestis, in collaboration with The Exploration Company (TEC), faced a setback when its capsule, carrying the ashes of 166 individuals and cannabis seeds, crashed into the Pacific Ocean. Launched on June 23, 2025, the 'Mission Possible' capsule completed two Earth orbits before a reentry anomaly caused its destruction.

title: Cardi B reacts to Stefon Diggs' European vacation with a cryptic 3-word message that fans can’t ignore
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: Tyrese Haliburton joins Jade Jones for July 4 celebrations amid post surgery recovery
content: Despite recovering from Achilles surgery, Tyrese Haliburton celebrated the Fourth of July with his girlfriend, Jade Jones, attending a concert where he was seen in a boot. Jones shared glimpses of their celebration on Instagram, including beach outings with friends and supportive messages for Haliburton after the Pacers' NBA Finals loss.

title: NBA trade rumors: Golden State Warriors could acquire $52.6 million
content: Golden State Warriors are making moves. They completed a seven-team trade involving Kevin Durant. Now, they might target Los Angeles Lakers' LeBron James. A trade could send Jimmy Butler to the Lakers. In return, Warriors would get James and his son, Bronny. Stephen Curry and James played well together in the Olympics. This potential duo could reshape the NBA.

title: IND vs ENG: KL Rahul left baffled as Josh Tongue sends middle stump flying — Watch
content: Josh Tongue delivered a stunning blow in the second Test, dismissing KL Rahul with a brilliant delivery. Rahul, who was looking comfortable at 55, was undone by Tongue's pace and precision as the ball crashed into his middle stump. This crucial breakthrough gave England a glimmer of hope on Day 4, ending a promising partnership and shifting the momentum.

title: Naveen Patnaik requests EAM to personally intervene for release of Odisha man kidnapped in Mali
content: Naveen Patnaik has appealed to the External Affairs Ministry for intervention following the suspected abduction of P Venkatramana, an Indian worker from Odisha, after an attack on a cement factory in Mali. The Ministry has confirmed the abduction of three Indian nationals, with the Indian embassy in Bamako coordinating with local authorities.

title: England batter joins cricket’s embarrassing club during Edgbaston Test
content: Brydon Carse etched his name in cricket's history by recording the 10,000th duck in Test cricket during the second Test between India and England at Edgbaston on July 5, 2025. This milestone occurred amidst a captivating day's play where Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell helped India dismiss England for 407, despite a strong fightback led by Jamie Smith and Harry Brook.

title: Pakistan building collapse: 16 dead, several feared trapped
content: In Karachi's Lyari neighbourhood, a six-storey residential building collapsed, resulting in 16 fatalities and 13 injuries. Rescue teams are tirelessly searching for survivors, with at least eight people still believed to be trapped. Authorities claim the building was declared unsafe and eviction notices were issued, but residents deny receiving them, highlighting the ongoing blame game amidst the tragedy.

title: 'How did they play?' - Gavaskar questions Bumrah's rest with Kapil Dev remarks
content: Jasprit Bumrah's absence in the Edgbaston Test raised eyebrows, prompting Sunil Gavaskar to compare modern workload management with the past. Gavaskar highlighted Kapil Dev's relentless training regimen, emphasizing natural conditioning over gym-centric fitness. The debate centers on whether today's cricketers are being overprotected, contrasting with the rugged endurance of previous generations.

title: 'Maha' Thackeray reset: Raj, Uddhav vow to 'stay together'; flay Mahayuti
content: In a significant political development, Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray reunited after two decades at a rally in Mumbai, demonstrating a united front against the perceived imposition of Hindi in Maharashtra. The Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS chiefs criticised the state government's policies, alleging attempts to undermine Maharashtra's identity and economy.

title: 'Amazing results don't make Gukesh world's best rapid player overnight': FIDE CEO
content: D Gukesh's stellar performance at the Super United Rapid and Blitz tournament in Zagreb, marked by six wins, propelled him into the limelight. Despite Gukesh's impressive showing, FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky cautioned against prematurely crowning him the world's best rapid player. Sutovsky acknowledged Gukesh's exceptional performance places him among the elite, emphasizing consistent results define true greatness.

title: 'Ab toh retire ho gaya': Gambhir’s quip on Rohit sparks laughter - Watch
content: During an appearance on The Kapil Sharma Show, Rishabh Pant playfully mentioned Rohit Sharma as someone who bosses everyone around in the Indian team. Gautam Gambhir humorously responded, pointing out Rohit's recent Test retirement.

title: 'Jai Gujarat' row: Uddhav lands 'Pushpa' punch at Shinde; calls him 'gaddar'
content: Uddhav Thackeray criticized Eknath Shinde for chanting "Jai Gujarat" at a rally with Amit Shah, questioning his respect for Marathi culture. This occurred amidst a language row and a joint rally by Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS against Hindi imposition. Uddhav accused the central government of moving Mumbai's establishments and businesses to Gujarat, weakening Maharashtra's economy.

title: 'Pehle maar raha hai': Pant's witty jibe at Siraj after bouncer hits Bashir
content: During the second Test between India and England, Rishabh Pant's humorous comment was caught on the stump mic after Mohammed Siraj's bouncer hit Shoaib Bashir. Siraj apologised immediately, prompting Pant's witty remark. Siraj and Akash Deep's impressive bowling performance, claiming all 10 wickets, helped India secure a significant 180-run lead on Day 3.

title: India-US trade deal: Rahul takes 'Modi will meekly bow' dig; Piyush Goyal hits back
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized PM Modi, anticipating he would yield to Trump's tariff deadline amid US trade talks. Piyush Goyal affirmed India's commitment to protecting its national interests, particularly for farmers and industries, during negotiations. While the US seeks tariff reductions on agricultural products, India aims for concessions in labor-intensive sectors like textiles and leather.

title: Lalu's 'Owaisi' dilemma: Will RJD align with AIMIM for Bihar polls?
content: Bihar gears up for crucial elections. Opposition strategists work to counter the ruling NDA. Owaisi's AIMIM seeks alliance with Lalu Yadav's RJD. RJD fears AIMIM could split Muslim votes. AIMIM won five seats in 2020, denting opposition prospects. RJD accuses AIMIM of being BJP's B-team. AIMIM denies the charge and prepares to contest, alliance or not.

title: Neeraj Chopra Classic: Date, Time, Live Streaming – All You Need to Know
content: India is set to host its first World Athletics Continental Tour Gold Level event, the Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025, in Bengaluru on July 5. Spearheaded by Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra, the event will feature top javelin throwers like Thomas Röhler and Julius Yego.

title: Arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari declared fugitive; India steps closer to extradition
content: A Delhi court has declared arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari a Fugitive Economic Offender, boosting India's efforts to extradite him from the UK. Bhandari, who fled to London in 2016, faces scrutiny from investigative agencies. The ruling poses challenges for Robert Vadra, who is under investigation for alleged links to Bhandari concerning a London property purchase.

title: Explained: How Jane Street made Rs 735 cr profit in 1 day; SEBI reveals details
content: SEBI has banned Jane Street Group from Indian markets. The firm allegedly inflated prices before selling aggressively, profiting from options while retail investors were misled. SEBI is now seizing Rs 4,840 crore in unlawful gains, highlighting concerns about algorithmic trading's impact on the Indian derivatives market.

title: 'Got pregnant thrice': UP madrassa teacher held for sexually assaulting student for 3 yrs
content: A 22-year-old student from Bihar has accused a madrassa teacher in Meerut of confinement, torture, and sexual assault over three years. The survivor reported being forced into three abortions by the teacher and his wife. Police have arrested the teacher and filed charges against him and his wife, initiating a thorough investigation into the serious allegations.

title: Rajasthan shocker: Man beaten to death in Bhilwara; cops deployed, markets shut
content: In Rajasthan's Bhilwara district, Sitaram Keer died after a road accident led to mob violence. The incident occurred in Jahazpur, triggering communal tensions. Hindu groups protested, and the VHP called for a Muharram procession ban. Police have been deployed, and three individuals are detained. An investigation is underway, and a temple event has been postponed.

title: 'You rule Assembly, we rule streets': Raj Thackeray to Mahayuti govt
content: Uddhav and Raj Thackeray united at a Mumbai rally, celebrating the withdrawal of the three-language policy GRs. Raj Thackeray criticised the BJP-led Mahayuti for imposing Hindi without discussion, emphasizing Marathi unity's strength. This rare joint appearance followed protests against making Hindi compulsory in schools, highlighting cultural unity over political differences after the government's decision reversal.

title: Bihar polls: ADR moves SC over revision of electoral rolls; calls EC move illegal
content: The Supreme Court is now hearing a challenge to the Election Commission's directive for Special Intensive Revision of Electoral Rolls in Bihar, just before elections. Association for Democratic Reforms argues this could disenfranchise lakhs of marginalized voters, violating free and fair election principles.

title: Watch: MNS workers vandalise bizman's Mumbai office over post on Marathi
content: Entrepreneur Sushil Kedia faced backlash after his social media post about not learning Marathi despite living in Mumbai for 30 years. MNS workers vandalized Kedia's Mumbai office, prompting condemnation from BJP leaders. Kedia claimed he was being tracked by police under the guise of protection. The incident sparked debate about language pride and the limits of expression in Maharashtra.

title: 'Take it or leave it': Trump says US tariff letters ready for 12 countries
content: US President Donald Trump is set to send tariff letters to twelve countries starting Monday, with new reciprocal rates potentially effective from August 1, 2025. Trump’s letters will be sent with the American side indicating a ‘take it or leave it’ offers.

title: Bihar shocker: Bizman Gopal Khemka shot dead outside Patna house
content: Businessman Gopal Khemka was murdered near Gandhi Maidan in Patna, mirroring the earlier killing of his son, BJP leader Gunjan Khemka, in 2018. Police are investigating the shooting, having recovered a bullet and shell from the scene. The incident has sparked political criticism, with RJD leaders condemning the government's handling of law and order.

title: Science uncovers visual illusion in mind: Your brain may be 15 seconds behind reality
content: A groundbreaking study has unveiled a surprising truth about our perception of time: the present moment is not as straightforward as it seems. Our brains intricately delay and blend visual signals from the previous 15 seconds, creating a polished, uninterrupted experience that shields us from the sensory overload of reality.

title: Paras Chhabra breaks silence on Parag Tyagi walking dog after Shefali’s death
content: Following Shefali Jariwala's unexpected death, her husband Parag Tyagi faced criticism for walking their dog, Simba. Paras, a close friend, defended Parag, explaining the deep bond they shared with their pet, who is considered a family member. The dog's distress and Parag's increased responsibility towards the aging pet highlight the profound loss felt in their home.

title: Is July 7 a day off? Muharram may close schools; full list of breaks & observances"
content: As schools reopen in July 2025, students begin the new academic session with excitement and several holidays to look forward to. With Muharram expected on July 7, many schools may remain closed. Additionally, Sunday holidays, monsoon-related local closures, and significant observances such as Bakrid, World Youth Skills Day, and Kargil Vijay Diwas make the month eventful. Students are also engaging in creative and skill-based activities, making the most of their holiday time.

title: National Herald case: Congress attempt to revive AJL, Rahul Gandhi’s counsel submits in court
content: The case stems from the assignment of a ₹90 crore loan advanced by the Congress party to AJL, the publisher of National Herald Paper, to Young Indian for a consideration of ₹50 lakh

title: Sigachi blast toll rises to 39 as one more worker succumbs
content: Repatriation to the worker’s native place is being done with police escort, two constables per ambulance, ensuring smooth travel and paperwork: Sangareddy SP Paritosh Pankaj

title: Skin bank at Government Medical College, Thiruvananthapuram, to be inaugurated on July 15
content: The inauguration of the facility has been scheduled for July 15 to coincide with the World Plastic Surgery Day observance

title: Bungalow to serve as guest house for Ministers, senior officials to come up in Tiruchi
content: Tiruchi Corporation has submitted a proposal seeking special grant of ₹4.5 crore from the State government to execute the project at near the headworks at Kambarasampettai

title: Students raise alarm over hostel conditions at Kottayam MCH
content: Chandy Oommen, MLA, visits men’s hostel, housed in a 60-year-old building, and demands that the structural safety of all buildings on the campus be examined. Hostel residents say they are forced to live in unsafe conditions

title: Intensify mosquito control measures, remove stagnant water sources: Chittoor DM&HO
content: Rapid test kits supplied to all primary health centres for blood sample testing for suspected dengue cases, says D.T. Sudharani

title: Residents pitch for implementing 2019 HC directive on building service lanes
content: Residents’ association has opposed any move to reduce the width of the service lanes as proposed by the Highways Department and wants the width to be retained at 45 metres

title: APMC asks FMGs to wait for NMC clarification on internship duration
content: The guidelines issued by the NMC in November 2023 have been adhered to, it insists; support pours in for FMGs from various associations and political parties

title: Indian-origin man jailed for life for rape of child after U.K. police probe
content: Navroop Singh (24) was sentenced to life imprisonment with a minimum term of 14 years behind bars for five charges, including rape, at Isleworth Crown Court

title: Land slip at Anmod Ghat; Belagavi-Goa connectivity affected
content: Following incessant rainfall in Uttara Kannada district, landslip has occurred at Anmod Ghat on Ramnagar-Goa road on Friday night, affecting Belagavi-Goa connectivity

title: APSSDC announces job opportunities in Kuwait
content: Male candidates aged between 24 and 50 years and holding ITI or Diploma in ceramic flooring, painting, electrical or ceiling works, along with three to five years of work experience can apply, says APSSDC Executive Director

title: India, Maldives hold talks to deepen trade and investment ties
content: The meeting, held at the Maldivian Economic Ministry, focused on exploring new areas of economic collaboration and strengthening existing trade ties

title: Calicut varsity V-C sets up panel on FYUGP
content: Teachers organisations’ say the recent revision of a clause in the FYUGP regulations will curtail the students’ freedom to choose minor courses in a different discipline from the same department that offers the major (main) course.

title: With PM Modi in Argentina, Congress recalls India's deep connect with country, Indira's 1968 visit
content: Jairam Ramesh shared two photographs — one of Singh from his time at UNCTAD and another of Gandhi with Ocampo at Buenos Aires

title: T.N. CM Stalin to launch ‘Ungaludan Stalin’ on July 15 for doorstep delivery of government services
content: Under this initiative, a total of 10,000 special camps will be organised across both rural and urban areas in all districts from July 15 to November

title: Rise in coconut prices a continuation of a global phenomenon dating back to 2020
content: As coconut availability is returning to normal in places like Tamil Nadu, officials expect the prices to stabilise in another two to three months.

title: Himachal Pradesh monsoon havoc: Over 260 roads closed, 3 districts under red alert for July 6
content: The local MeT office issues a ‘red’ alert for very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places in Kangra, Sirmaur and Mandi districts on July 6

title: OPEC+ To Hike Petrol Output To 548,000 Barrels Per Day In August
content: Saudi Arabia, Russia and six other key members of the OPEC+ alliance said they would further increase oil output in August to 548,000 barrels per day.

title: Pope Leo Takes First Action To Address Abuse By Catholic Clergy
content: Pope Leo appointed a French archbishop as the new leader of the Vatican's commission on clergy sexual abuse, in the US pontiff's first public move to confront an issue that has damaged the global Church's credibility.

title: How "Mooli Devi" Faked Identity, Worked As Cop In Rajasthan For 2 Years
content: A woman has been arrested after masquerading for nearly two years as a police sub-inspector inside the Rajasthan Police Academy (RPA), attending training sessions, wearing official uniforms, and even posing for photographs with senior police officers

title: Paris Opens River Seine For Public Swimming For First Time Since 1923
content: Parisians rushed for a dip in the Seine as the authorities opened the river to public swimming for the first time since 1923 after an extensive clean-up operation spurred on by it being used as a venue in the Paris Olympics.

title: Adani Ports Unveils Steel Slag Road in Hazira, World's 1st In A Private Port
content: In a landmark step for green infrastructure, Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) has inaugurated the world's first steel slag road at any port, setting a new global benchmark in circular economy-led development.

title: EPS Launches AIADMK's New Logo, Kicks Off 2026 Campaign With Sharp Attack on DMK
content: AIADMK General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Friday launched a new party logo and unveiled the slogan "Protecting People, Redeeming Tamil Nadu" ahead of his state-wide election tour for the 2026 assembly polls.

title: Video: Speeding Scorpio Loses Control, Rams Hoarding In UP
content: Parts of the car flew in the air and an hoarding crashed to the ground after a speeding Scorpio SUV rammed into a pole in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj.

title: 1 Wall, 4 Litres Of Paint, 233 People: Madhya Pradesh School's Math Miracle
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district, a miracle of mathematics and manpower has been achieved: 168 labourers and 65 masons were employed to apply four litres of paint to a government school wall in Sakandi village.

title: Passengers Jump From Plane's Wing After Fire Alert On Flight Before Takeoff In Spain
content: At least 18 people were injured after a fire broke out on a Ryanair Boeing 737 aircraft at Palma de Mallorca Airport (PMI) in Spain. The incident occurred on Saturday, just when the Manchester-bound plane was about to take off.

title: "Our Goal Is...": EPS Launches AIADMK Campaign Logo Ahead Of 2026 Polls
content: AIADMK General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami on Saturday launched his 2026 election campaign with the release of a new logo and slogan from the party headquarters, 'MGR Maligai', in Chennai.

title: Bengaluru Court Restrains Kamal Haasan From Making Remarks Against Kannada
content: A court here on Friday passed an ex-parte interim injunction order restraining actor Kamal Haasan from making any remarks against Kannada language.

title: Nirav Modi's Brother Arrested In US On Extradition Request From India
content: Fugitive business Nirav Modi's brother has been arrested in the United States on an extradition request from India.

title: Over 260 Roads Closed, Extreme Heavy Rain Alert Continues In Himachal Pradesh
content: The weather department has warned of possible landslides, flash floods, waterlogging, and damage to vulnerable structures, crops, and essential services.

title: "Glad I Am Able To Attend": Kiren Rijiju At Dalai Lama's 90th Birthday Event
content: Apart from Mr Rijiju, Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu and renowned Hollywood actor Richard Gere also attended the Dalai Lama's 90th birthday celebrations.

title: Tension In Rajasthan's Bhilwara After Man Lynched Over Minor Collision
content: The incident occurred when a car carrying four persons from the Tonk Cantonment area accidentally collided with a handcart while passing through Jahazpur's main market.

title: Man Found Dead In Lift After Fire At Vishal Mega Mart In Delhi's Karol Bagh
content: A 25-year-old man was found dead inside a lift after a massive fire broke out at a Vishal Mega Mart outlet in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Friday.

title: Watch: Abu Dhabi Tests First Driverless Air Taxi, Launch Set For 2026
content: Abu Dhabi has completed its first test flight of a driverless electric air taxi, with plans to launch commercial services by early 2026.

title: Trump "Very Unhappy" With Putin Call, Says He Wants To "Keep Killing People"
content: US President Donald Trump said Friday he was "very unhappy" about his telephone call with Vladimir Putin on the war in Ukraine, saying the Russian leader just wanted to "keep killing people."

title: Kolkata College Meeting Records Over Complaints Against 'Mango' Mishra Under Scanner
content: The minutes of successive governing body meetings of South Calcutta Law College (New Campus), located in Kasba in South Kolkata, have come under the scanner of investigating officials probing the case of rape of a law student on June 2.

title: Citizens protest against delay in opening of Yellow Line of Namma Metro in Bengaluru
content: The Yellow Line — a critical 19-km corridor connecting R.V. Road to Bommasandra via key bottlenecks like Silk Board — was originally scheduled to open in 2021

title: A ‘coconut tree doctor’ who went around examining coconut trees
content: P.V. Vijayan’s mandate not only included examinining the palms every three months and take necessary measures, but also the application of pesticides and fertlizers.

title: Wild elephant overeats mangoes, dies of indigestion
content: The carcass, entangled among bamboo thickets, was initially found by local villagers passing the road, and they promptly informed area forest staff

title: Complaint against police for collecting money from shopkeepers in Bengaluru
content: According to the complaint, police allegedly collect money from around 100 shops in migrant labourers’ colony in and around Varthur in Bengaluru by threatening to book cases against residents under The Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA)

title: BC, OC employees of A.P. Secretariat demand fair deal in promotions in line with High Court ruling
content: The employees drew the Chief Secretary’s attention to the Andhra Pradesh High Court order given in 2018 asking the government to review the injustice in promotions within the A.P. Secretariat

title: 7.3 acres land abutting KPHB-Hitec City corridor to be auctioned by Telangana Housing Board
content: The Board’s vice chairman said that the State government has permitted to utilise the revenue generated for affordable housing schemes such as Indiramma Houses

title: No direct correlation between cardiovascular events and COVID-19 exposure and vaccination, finds Jayadeva hospital study
content: The team has recommended establishment of a cardiac surveillance programme and national registry for sudden cardiac death among young adults

title: Uddhav-Raj Thackeray joint rally: ‘Desperate bid’ to revive political fortunes, ‘family reunion’, says BJP
content: Mr. Uddhav and Mr. Raj shared the public stage and hosted a victory gathering titled 'Awaj Marathicha' in Mumbai's Worli to celebrate the rollback of two Government Resolutions

title: We negotiate from position of strength, not under deadlines: Piyush Goyal on U.S. trade deal after Congress jab
content: Piyush Goyal also accused the Congress of  "negotiating and signing agreements that were not in the national interest" during that party-led UPA government's tenure

title: Elephants damage crops in Vizianagaram, Parvatipuram districts
content: Residents of Sivvaram, Sitharampuram, Gorapadu, Chinabagga villages alleged that the Forest department had not taken initiative to drive away the elephants into forest area

title: Bomb explosion in West Bengal's Purba: One killed, another injured
content: Locals said the explosion occurred in an abandoned house, often frequented by anti-social elements, allegedly for manufacturing crude bombs

title: YS Jagan’s image continues to  remain intact among public, says YSRCP regional coordinator
content: The party which got 40% vote share in 2024 General Elections would come back to power in 2020 with a thumping majority, says party regional coordinator K Kannababu

title: Kerala’s framework for river basin conservation envisions long-term and annual action plans
content: While long-term plan will serve as ‘cornerstone’ of sustainable river basin management, annual action plans will break down broader objectives into specific tasks, prioritising objectives for each year

title: Ramachander Rao takes charge as BJP Telangana chief, vows to win local body elections
content: Mr. Rao said that his top priorities include  strengthening the party from the grassroots level with a focus on improving its rural base

title: Deadly fungus threatens endangered Western Ghats tree
content: Infection of critically endangered Dipterocarpus bourdillonii by aggressive pathogen Corynespora cassiicola sparks urgent call for conservation

title: Centre asks States to crack down on manufacturers selling sub-standard helmets
content: A Quality Control Order has been in force since 2021, mandating ISI-marked helmets certified under BIS standards for all two-wheeler riders.

title: Nirav Modi’s brother Nehal Modi held in U.S. on extradition request from India
content: The next date for the hearing in the matter is July 17, when Nihal may seek bail, but it will be opposed by the U.S. prosecutors

title: One Maoist killed in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: Based on the intelligence received about the presence of a large cadre of Maoists in the National Park area of the Bijapur district, a search operation was conducted, a senior police officer said

title: T.N. trains college teachers to set question papers testing students’ analytical, problem-solving skills
content: The government in December 2024 launched a training programme for the faculty of all State universities and government colleges. The revised Bloom’s Taxonomy forms the core of the programme

title: Elderly woman injured from electric trap set for wild boars in Kerala’s Palakkad
content: Police say Malathi, 65, suffered serious burn injuries from electric wire installed in her house compound and that it was not clear who set the trap

title: BJD demands action against BJP MLA for sexist slur
content: ‘BJP MLA Santosh Khatua’s  statement about me amounts to outraging my modesty,’ says BJP spokesperson Lekhashree

title: Sanjay Bhandari, U.K.-based arms consultant, declared fugitive economic offender
content: The ED had filed a criminal case of money laundering against Mr. Bhandari and others in February 2017

title: Srisailam temple to issue online tokens for free sparsha darshan
content: The management of Sri Bhramarambha Mallikarjuna Swamy temple had recently commenced the free sparsha darshan facility for four days in a week for the convenience of the common devotees.

title: MLC seeks more cardiologists at Jayadeva hospital in Mysuru
content: Congress MLC Dinesh Gooli Gowda claims that the patient load at the Jayadeva hospital in Mysuru has doubled, with the number of daily patients rising from the capacity of 700 to around 1,500

title: Uddhav-Raj Thackeray joint rally: We have come together to stay together, says Uddhav Thackeray
content: In a lighter vein, Raj Thackeray said Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has managed to bring him and Uddhav together, a feat he said even Balasaheb Thackeray could not accomplish.

title: GTRI cautions against imports of GM farm products from U.S.; may affect India's agricultural exports
content: India's fragmented agri-logistics and lack of segregation infrastructure make cross-contamination likely, risking trace GM presence in export consignments, GTRI Founder Ajay Srivastava said

title: NGO moves Supreme Court challenging ECI’s Special Intensive Revision of rolls in Bihar
content: The petition filed by NGO, Association for Democratic Reforms, represented by advocates Prashant Bhushan and Neha Rathi, contended that the ECI’s SIR communication breach the provisions of Representation of People’s Act, 1950 and Rule 21A of the Registration of Electors Rules, 1960

title: BSF Eastern Command reviews operational preparedness through technology modernisation
content: Officials hoped for improved cooperation with Border Guard Bangladesh and State police forces for better management of borders

title: NIA arrests 2 key men involved in human trafficking to U.S. via 'dunki' route
content: According to the NIA investigation, Gagandeep used to take around ₹45 lakh from each traveller and would promise to send them to the U.S. on a valid legal visa

title: Consumer rights panel in Kerala slaps ₹2.66-lakh fine on infertility clinic for alleged cheating of childless couple
content: Ernakulam District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission observes that failure to provide promised treatment amounts to deficiency in service

title: Muharram beyond the main procession: the pulse of faith in smaller ashoorkhanas
content: Far from the public glare and ceremonial avenues, Hyderabad’s lesser known ashoorkhanas hold a quieter, deeper rhythm of Muharram where the legacy of Karbala endures through fading walls, whispered laments and generations of unbroken faith

title: Nitin Gadkari to inaugurate Sigandur bridge in Shivamogga on July 14, says B.Y. Raghavendra
content: BJP leader Raghavendra appealed to the State Government to send a proposal to the Centre on naming the bridge after Sigandur Chowdeshwari, the deity worshipped by many in the district.

title: High-quality diet may have led to bigger human brain: CSIR-CCMB-led international study reveals genetic link between diet and brain size
content: An international study involving scientists from the United States and China, has uncovered the genetic mechanisms linking diet quality and brain size in primates; it reveals that the quality of food primates eat influences not just their energy levels but also the way their brains evolve at the genetic level

title: PM will ‘meekly bow’ to Trump’s deadline on the Indo-U.S. trade deal, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress has been targeting the PM for not countering Trump’s repeated claims that he used the threat of suspending trade to end hostilities between India and Pakistan

title: Dalai Lama says he hopes to live for another 40 years
content: Dalai Lama was speaking during a ceremony by his followers to offer prayers for his long life ahead of his 90th birthday on July 6, 2025.

title: One dead, more feared trapped after portion of illegal coal mine collapses in Jharkhand
content: An administrative team has been dispatched for relief and rescue operation at Karma area in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district

title: JSK – Janaki v/s State of Kerala row: High Court judge watches controversial movie at Kochi film studio
content: Kerala High Court, which is considering a petition by film’s production company seeking a directive to CBFC to issue censor certificate, had earlier stated that it was appropriate to watch the movie before arriving at a decision

title: Odisha BJP reluctant to defend party leader Jagannath Pradhan arrested for attack on govt. officer
content: The saffron party is concerned over its image following stampede in Puri and spate of gang-rape incidents

title: 36 Amarnath pilgrims injured after 5 buses collide in J&K’s Ramban; rejoin yatra after treatment
content: The buses were part of a convoy headed for Pahalgam base camp in south Kashmir from Jammu's Bhagwati Nagar

title: Mohan Majhi govt. to upgrade Puri into municipal corporation
content: The new corporation will include Puri town and seven to eight panchayats from the adjoining Brahmagiri block

title: Ladli Behna Yojana monthly aid to be ₹1,500 after Diwali: M.P. CM Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav said a special budget of ₹27,147 crore has been earmarked for women, including ₹18,699 crore for the Ladli Behna scheme

title: Canada striker David signs 5-year Juventus deal
content: Canada  forward  Jonathan David  signed a five-year contract with  Juventus  on Friday. After his five-year contract at  Lille  expired, David joined the record 36-time Italian champion on a free transfer. The deal is worth €6 million ($7 million) per season, with up to €2 million ($2.4 million) in bonuses, Gazzetta dello Sport reported. It's the first big market move by new Juventus general manager Damien Comolli, who confirmed last month that Igor Tudor will stay on as coach. Juventus needs firepower up front with  Dusan Vlahovic  having fallen out of favor and likely to leave the club. The 25-year-old David scored 25 goals and provided 12 assists in 49 matches across all competitions for Lille last season. David is also Canada's all-time leading scorer with 36 goals in 67 appearances.

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: 'I learned from it': Jason Pierre-Paul opens up about fireworks incident that cost him his fingers 10 years ago
content: ex-new york Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul owns a fourth of July accident that cost him 212 fingers . he has no choice but to be reminded of it when putting on a dress shirt and reaching for a button . "there's nothing to be embarrassed about," he tells ESPN last week .

title: Fluminense were Club World Cup underdogs. Now they're 90 minutes from the final
content: Fluminense beat Al-Hilal 2-1 to reach the club world cup semi-finals . Renato Portaluppi says his team are the "ugly duckling" when compared with others in the last eight . the 62-year-old says he's right, and whatever gap might exist in terms of bank balance wasn't on show .

title: 'He's trying to get perfection out of me': Jets pushing Sauce Gardner for more
content: the new york Jets ' expectations for Sauce Gardner are reminiscent of the old "Friday Night Lights" movie . he challenged the star cornerback to raise his game to a new level . "the fact that he's trying to get perfection out of me is what I need," he said .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel
content: the lakers are holding about $8 million with the remains of their midlevel exception . leBron James chose not to be a free agent during the opening week of free agency . olympic gold medalist robert mccarthy is a top free agent . the los Angeles lakers have been holding about $1.5 million in free agency this summer .

title: Texans' revamped offense coming together heading into training camp
content: the Texans will have a different pass game, multiple rushing schemes and more running in between the tackles . new coordinator Nick Caley will run the show with the texans this offseason . caley says he's in the discovery process when we get to work with them on the field .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .
